name: Roast Beef Tataki and Miso Pumpkin Salad | Marion's Kitchen
description: My version of Japanese tataki sees melt-in-the-mouth tender beef fillet in a beautiful, umami-rich marinade. Served with a fresh and fabulous salad, and you’ve got a weekend lunch of champions to impress your loved ones.
keywords: Beef, Dinner Party, Grill, Marion’s Original Salad Dressings, Miso & Sesame Vinaigrette, Roasts, Salad dressings, Salads, Sides
recipeIngredient: 1 tbsp vegetable oil, plus extra for drizzling
800g (1.7 lb) centre-cut piece beef eye fillet
1kg (2.2 lb) butternut pumpkin (squash), deseeded and cut into chunks
1 cup cooked brown, red or wild rice
1/3 cup Marion’s Kitchen Miso & Sesame Vinaigrette

recipeInstructions.text: Step 2.Place the pumpkin on a large baking tray. Drizzle with the olive oil and season with salt. Roast, turning halfway, for 40 minutes or until tender. Remove from the oven and allow to cool to room temperature.

Step 3.Heat the oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Season the beef with salt and add to the frying pan. Cook, turning, for 4 minutes or until just seared. Remove from pan and allow to cool slightly.
Step 4.In a large zip lock bag, combine the marinade ingredients. Then place the beef in the marinade. Seal and place in the fridge for 1-2 hours to marinate.
Step 6.Take the beef out of the marinade and pat it dry with paper towel. Place it onto a baking tray and drizzle with oil. Roast in the oven for 15 minutes (for rare) or until cooked to your liking.
Step 7.Take the beef out of the oven and rest for 5 minutes before thinly slicing.

Step 8.To make the miso pumpkin salad, mix the roasted pumpkin with the rice, edamame beans, pea shoots and Miso & Sesame Vinaigrette. Place onto a serving platter. Top with radish, pickled ginger and daikon if using. Serve with sliced beef.

publisher.name: Bring the Best Flavours of Asia to Home Kitchens
